title: Roger Ebert
summary: Roger Joseph Ebert (/ˈiːbərt/; June 18, 1942 – April 4, 2013) was an American film critic, film historian, journalist, screenwriter, and author. He was a film critic for the Chicago Sun-Times from 1967 until his death in 2013. In 1975, Ebert became the first film critic to win the Pulitzer Prize for Criticism. Neil Steinberg of the Chicago Sun-Times said Ebert "was without question the nation's most prominent and influential film critic,"[1] Tom Van Riper of Forbes described him as "the most powerful pundit in America,"[2] and Kenneth Turan of the Los Angeles Times called him "the best-known film critic in America."[3]
